    • Method Detail

      • createWindowFullscreen

        public void createWindowFullscreen()
        Creates a new full screen window.

        Utilizes JFrame to create the window. Sets the size of the frame to be the size of the screen automatically. The width and height specified in the constructor is for windowed size and setting the scale width.

        For example, if width is set at 500, and height at 500, anything bigger with scale up and anything smaller will scale down.

      • createWindowWindowed

        public void createWindowWindowed()
        Creates a new visible window using the specified width and height.

        Note that if resizable isn't stated, it is defaulted to false. If a canvas isn't stated, drawing isn't able to happen and an error will show in console. Location is also set to be centered in screen. This can be changed by using JFrame method setLocation.

      • windowedToFullscreen

        public void windowedToFullscreen()
        Switches the window from windowed to fullscreen.

      • fullscreenToWindowed

        public void fullscreenToWindowed()
        Switches the window from fullscreen to windowed.

      • getFrame

        public javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()
        Returns:
        Returns the JFrame created upon calling createWindowWindowed() or createWindowFullscreen().

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns:
        Returns whether or not the window is fullscreen or not.

      • getScaleWidth

        public double getScaleWidth()
        Returns:
        Returns the number needed to scale objects' height in relation to the screen sized based on initial stated width.

      • getScaleHeight

        public double getScaleHeight()
        Returns:
